name: Book Launch: LEARNING TO MAKE TEA FOR ONE by Andaleeb Wajid, moderated by Shrabonthi Bagchi | 10th May, 5:30 PM | Champaca, Vasanth Nagar
description: Join us at Champaca, Vasanth Nagar for the launch of LEARNING TO MAKE TEA FOR ONE: REFLECTIONS ON LOVE, LOSS AND HEALING, bestselling author  Andaleeb Wajid's  memoir. The author will be in conversation with journalist  Shrabonti Bagchi . We are looking forward to this evening of honest reflection on grief, family, and healing during the COVID-19 pandemic.  About the book: In the summer of 2021, India was devastated by the second wave of COVID-19. During this time,  Andaleeb Wajid  lost both her mother-in-law and her husband, even as she was hospitalised with COVID herself. Left with her two sons and a heart full of grief, she turned to writing. LEARNING TO MAKE TEA FOR ONE is an intimate, courageous memoir that reflects on grief, love, and the slow path to healing. Andaleeb writes of growing up with her father, of a marriage marked by joy and contrast, of motherhood’s delight and heartbreak - and of the unimaginable task of learning to live again, alone. Event Details: Date :  10thMay, 2025 Time :  5:30 PM  Venue :  Champaca Bookstore, Vasanth Nagar Since there is limited seating, we recommend you  book your spot soon. About the Speakers: Andaleeb Wajid  is a hybrid author with more than 45 novels to her name in the last 15 years, spanning romance, horror, and young adult fiction. Her YA novel  ASMARA'S SUMMER  was adapted into Dil, Dosti, Dilemma on Amazon Prime. In 2024, she released two YA novels:  SCARE WALK , a horror graphic novel, EVERYTHING SUCKS, a YA romance. Her acclaimed YA novel  THE HENNA START-UP  won the Neev Literature Festival Award 2024, the Crossword Book Award 2024, and received an honourable mention at the BK Awards 2024. Shrabonti Bagchi is a journalist and reviewer. She currently writes for Mint Lounge, a weekly magazine of art, culture, books and lifestyle.
